Ask HN: How to align browser tabs with its' contexts?
text:
I usually have hundreds of unorganised tabs that I can barely arrange. I just open a different window for a different context (supposedly learning a new thing => new window). But often I don't finish, thus leave them in the midst.

One viable solution I could come up with was the "different profile" thing (e.g. work profile, school profile). Yet opening up another profile for a temporary context doesn't sounds nice (supposedly it might be some tutorial that might take a week). And I don't want to close those tabs/tab groups and leave them like that, so even in that case they occupy some space (mental, or RAM).

Is there a thing which did help you to organise these tabs, so that you could close them and return after a while without actually losing anything?

Show HN: Neofetch for Git Repositories
text:
Onefetch is a command-line Git information tool that displays project information and code statistics for a local Git repository directly to your terminal. The tool is completely offline - no network access is required.

Source: https://github.com/o2sh/onefetch

title: Ask HN: Is clickwrap really the best way for users to accept a service contract?
text:
We offer hardware as a service. We ship them hardware and they pay us monthly.

Right now we send new customers a DocuSign agreement before accepting payment. While this feels legally strong since they have to actually sign the agreement, it creates significant friction in the sales process. It's surprising how many customers say they did not receive the contract.

We could put a clickwrap checkbox in our order form, but that feels legally weak and I know that means most customers won't read the contract.

What does HN think?

Ask HN: What to run on a 1cpu 0.5gb RAM machine?
text:
Already own a virtual machine instance (5 usd/month) and hosting a few simple services and website.

The website is single page. No complex backend. At most it fetches stuff from another web service and does some crawling/crunching. I don't expect high loads here.

Mainly asking for the website self-hosting purpose only.

Can I downgrade here? Also just wondering what do most people use a 1cpu 0.5gb machine for? VPN? Personal website? Or something else?

Show HN: GPT-3 powered Recruiting Email Generator
text:
Hello everyone! Today I am presenting a GPT-3 powered recruiting email generator.

Over the past few years, as many of you, I have been receiving an overwhelming number of recruiting emails both directly and via LinkedIn. Last week I was using some of my vacation and browsing through those messages, and I've noticed poorly executed obvious attempts of personalisation some of those have, or being simply poorly worded cold emails.

I thought to myself immediately about potential performance of GPT-3 in that field, and how such email generation could be easily automated, beating most of those human written generic messages.

I have also figured out, once I build such a tech demo, I could then respond to each of those unsummoned recruiting emails with a link to my tool, flipping the coin and turning recruiters into my leads.

Please let me know what you think about it. All feedback is welcome!
